intro: Gononcus undulatus, commonly known as the undulating gononcus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, undulating leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
